description: On March 11, the government of El Salvador is closing all schools and universities for a period of 21 days (until March 31).
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: On March 11, the government of El Salvador is closing all schools and universities for a period of 21 days (until March 31).
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: El Salvador's National Government mandates that the Ministry of Education must order the suspension of educational activities during a period of twenty-one (21) days, with the aim of protecting Salvadorans against the risks that may arise.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: El Salvador's National Government mandates that the Ministry of Education must order the suspension of educational activities during a period of twenty-one (21) days, with the aim of protecting Salvadorans against the risks that may arise.

description: On April 20, the Cuscatlán Municipality in El Salvador imposed a curfew from 9pm to 5am.
On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the Covid 19 Pandemia (until April 12).

On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16 in order for the assembly to discuss human rights concerns during quarantine enforcement. UPDATE: The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16.

On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16 in order for the assembly to discuss human rights concerns during quarantine enforcement. The state of emergency was again extended from April 16 to May 1. UPDATE: The original state of emergency was set to expire on April 16 but was extended until May 1, 2020.

On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16 in order for the assembly to discuss human rights concerns during quarantine enforcement. The state of emergency was again extended from April 16 to May 1. The state of emergency was extended again from May 1 to May 16. UPDATE: Originally, the government of El Salvador extended the state of emergency from April 16 to May 1 but it was announced on April 30 that this measure will be extended until May 16.
On January 31, the government of El Salvador banned the entry of people from China.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 25th, El Salvador banned the entry of foreigners coming from South Korea and Italy. Nationals, residents and diplomats, accepted under a 15-day quarantine period.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador banned on February 28th the entry of travellers coming from Iran.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador is enforcing a ban of entry of passengers arriving from Iran. UPDATE: The original travel ban applied to foreign passengers arriving from South Korea and Italy, it has been extended to travelers arriving from Iran.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador is enforcing an additional ban of entry of passengers arriving from Germany and France. UPDATE: The original travel ban applied to foreign passengers arriving from South Korea and Italy and Iran, it has been extended to travelers arriving from Germany and France.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 09th, El Salvador Government banned the entry of people coming from Spain, Germany and France
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador begins controlling passports of citizen and foreign travelers arriving from Guatemala, Nicaragua and Honduras.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador is enforcing an additional ban of entry of passengers arriving from Spain. March 10.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 11, El Salvador's Government ordered via decree of the Council of Ministers the prohibition of entry of any foreigner who is not a resident ordiplomat from the Salvadoran territory, action that must be followed by the National Directorate of Migration and Aliens.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: El Salvador is expanding its entry ban to foreign passengers arriving from all countries. UPDATE: The travel that ban applied to foreign passengers arriving from South Korea and Italy, Iran, France, Germany and Spain was expanded to all countries.
On March 19, the government of El Salvador ordered the closure of the El Salvador Airport.

El Salvador is enforcing an additional ban of entry of passengers arriving from Spain. UPDATE: The travel that ban applied to foreign passengers arriving from South Korea and Italy and Iran was expanded to travelers coming from Spain.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador Government enables 19 centres for COVID-19 quarantine in different areas of the country
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 17, the government of El Salvador announced that outpatient consultation of the 31 national hospitals and all health units are suspended until further notice.
type_text: The outpatient consultation of the 31 national hospitals and all health units they are suspended until further notice.

description: Construction of a  hospital has begun to attend the pandemic. It will have 300 Care Units Intensive and more than 2,000 hospital beds, exclusive for confirmed patients.
On March 17, the government of El Salvador ordered for the suspension of dental consultations, private or public, that are not deemed emergencies.

On May 25, the Health Ministry of El Salvador began to restrict testing for COVID-19. Tests will no longer necessarily be given to people who came in contact with an infected person nor to those who have symptoms, but rather according to the type of symptoms presented.
On July 27, the government of El Salvador installed three mobile booths to carry out COVID-19 tests in the city of San Salvador.

On March 16, the Vice Ministry of Transport and the Ministry of Public works will verify that public transport drivers wear face masks and make available alcohol gels for passengers, in addition to sanitizing the units 3 times a day.

On April 3, El Salvador's Ministry of Health announced that units providing public passenger transportation services must abide by the following hygienic measures:

a) Have alcohol gel available to all transport users, through
dispensers that will be located in the entrances enabled to it.
b) Keep public transport units disinfected at least three times
up to date. Disinfection activities include seats, floors, manners,
doors and other user contact surfaces.

On July 27, the government of El Salvador started disinfecting the interior and exterior of the houses in the urban area of <U+200B><U+200B>Metapán (municipality) with quaternary ammonium to prevent COVID-19 on the walls, floors, and other surfaces.

From May 7th, and for 15 days (initially), El Salvador has established more restrictive containment measures  that include, among others, the possibility of carrying out certain procedures one or two specific days of the week
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
The public sector and private companies must send home, without exception, to
following workers:
<U+25CF> Over 60 years,
<U+25CF> Pregnant women,
<U+25CF> People with chronic diseases, such as kidney failure,
immunosuppressed, serious heart conditions and all cases that
indicate the Ministry of Labor.
type_text: The public sector and private companies must send home, without exception, to following workers: <U+25CF> Over 60 years, <U+25CF> Pregnant women, <U+25CF> People with chronic diseases, such as kidney failure, immunosuppressed, serious heart conditions and all cases that indicate the Ministry of Labor.

description:
The Consumer Protection Office will initiate pricing to prevent abuse
and hoarding will be fined.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: El Salvador is enforcing a quarantine on all passengers, including Salvadoran nationals arriving from China.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador is enforcing a 30-day quarantine on national citizens and diplomats arriving from Italy and South Korea.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: El Salvador is enforcing a 30-day quarantine on national passengers and foreign diplomats arriving from Iran. UPDATE: The original quarantine was for national passengers and foreign diplomats arriving from Italy and South Korea, it has been extended to national passengers and diplomats arriving from Iran.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Salvadorans, residents, and diplomats entering the country will enter
30-day quarantine with no exceptions and no privileges.

The President of the Republic, Nayib Bukele, decreed Mandatory Household Quarantine for all Salvadorans for the next 30 days, to prevent the advance of the pandemic COVID-19. 

*On April 6th, the Quarantine was extended for 15 days more. UPDATE: The original quarantine in El Salvador was set to last until April 19, it has been extended 15 days.
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 21, The President of the El Salvador, Nayib Bukele, decreed Mandatory Household Quarantine for all Salvadorans for the next 30 days, to prevent the advance of the pandemic COVID-19. 

*On April 6th, the Quarantine was extended for 15 days more.
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Duicenters, bars, clubs and gyms must be closed for at least 14 days,
from the moment it was decreed.

On March 17, the government of El Salvador recommended to companies that are not food, medicine or supplies necessary for the operation of the country, to send the staff to home, for a fee. The Government will benefit all companies that thus they do so, prequalifying them with productive and working capital credits for part of the Mortgage Bank.
type_text: Restriction of workers of non-essential business

description:
In El Salvador the service is suspended in all restaurants, cafes, dining rooms from 6 p.m. of this day (03/18). The operation will be allowed
 of these businesses under the modalities to take, to domiciles and windows of self-service. This measure is taken after a thorough analysis to prevent the contagion and at the same time guarantee -as far as possible- the subsistence of people who live on these jobs and small businesses.
On March 19, the government of El Salvador ordered the closure of shopping malls.
On July 3, the city of Sonsonate in El Salvador banned street sales for 10 days to reduce COVID-19 infections.
On July 4, the mayor San Miguel (in El Salvador) announced that the the central market of the city will close for 7 days.

description: On March 16, the government of El Salvador suspended all public shows and sporting events.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: On March 17, the government of El Salvador prohibited agglomerations of more than 50 people are prohibited, except workplaces, people in circulation and bus terminals.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: On March 16, the government of El Salvador suspended all public shows and sporting events. Effective August 6, all public shows and sporting events (including soccer stadiums) will open up to the public. UPDATE: On March 16, the government of El Salvador forced closure of public shows and sporting events but this policy will end on August 6.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: The mayor of San Miguel, El Salvador announced the cancellation of the Carnival of San Miguel which would was scheduled to take place on November 28.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description:
On April 3, El Salvador's Ministry of Health announced that units providing public passenger service must the following preventive sanitary measures:

a) The mandatory use of PPE (personal protective equipment) masks for the motorcyclist and other support or control employees in the units.
b) Transport a maximum of passengers that does not exceed the number of two people per seat in the bus and microbus units.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
type_text: In the units that provide the public passenger service, the following preventive sanitary measures: a) The mandatory use of PPE (personal protective equipment) masks for the motorcyclist and other support or control employees in the units. b) Have alcohol gel available to all transport users, through dispensers that will be located in the entrances enabled to it. c) Keep public transport units disinfected at least three times up to date. Disinfection activities include seats, floors, manners, doors and other user contact surfaces. d) Transport a maximum of passengers that does not exceed the number of two people per seat in the bus and microbus units.

On May 10, the president published a decree allowing health workers to use public transportation.
